title: Still waiting for the day Riven gets some type of risk/punishment in her kit like everyone else..
body:
Builds glass cannon. Gets rewarded with huge ad shield to be tanky.
Mashes Q the second it's off cd. Gets rewarded with extreme mobility. 
Somehow fucks up with her Q. Gets rewarded with an AoE stun. 
Messes up on combo. Gets rewarded with a ranged execute. 

Oh, wait..i'm sorry she does have a risk. She doesn't have amazing hp p/5 anymore..my bad forgot how drastic that nerf was

replies.body:
It is actually quite easy to punish Riven; she is extremely susceptible to poke damage. 
Play someone such as Jayce or Darius and Riven will be dead in no time.

The main strength of Riven is that she has possibly the best all-in potential in game. Contrast to Talon's fastest AD Ratio per Second combo, Riven has one of the highest Ratio per combo. Rather than surviving the burst, one needs to stop Riven before she finishes her attack - otherwise she will just overpower her opponent.

Essentially, this makes it a bad idea for prolonged trade against Riven. 
Her weakness is that she can't quickly regenerate health. Picking someone such as Volibear  or Garen who can gain his/her HP back quickly will put Riven at a severe disadvantage. Additionally, champions with high Life steal can out duel Riven if they can survive her initial combo. (ie. Olaf, Udyr)

Nonetheless, due to her overwhelming strength, some match-ups against Riven are the most one-sided in League. Yasuo and Aatrox pretty much stand no chance against Riven. Riven's combo is simply stronger than Yasuo's at all stages in melee range. While Aatrox can't seriously fight Riven because he needs to turn off Blood Thirst for Blood Price when he trades.

The risk of playing Riven is simply of being countered, or going against someone who will not mindlessly engage you during the laning phase.

Because it creates powerful and fight-deciding decisions in the heat of the moment. As you say, you can just CC her (or Yi, or other low-range hyper carries), and while the typical forumer does not like that answer, it is true and its rare to have a team that has no hard CC at all.
The problem is its a reasonably difficult skill to be able to focus on the current state of the fight while being mindful of possible future states, and make decisions based on both the current state and what you think are the likely outcomes. You want proof, play ARAM. Champs like Kat force this kind of decision making, its not easy (and nor should it be), but when the wrong decision often leads to a Kat pentakill, its easy to see why its frustrating.

No it doesn't? All it takes it the slightest critical thinking. Whoever had the CC to stop her just has to wait until she does something, it doesn't become a big issue unless your team makes it one. Their isn't that much skill and any time I have seen Kat in aram she got bullied any time she attempted to come near our side.

The difference between Kat and Yi is once Kat ults she essentially becomes useless, while Yi just keeps slashing you with a sword after the CC wears off. 

Kat might be annoying in lane for someone who can't do anything to stop her ult, but the hate she is getting might just be people trying to find something to hate.

It seems so simple to say 'just wait and save your CC for Kat'. It really does.

In a shifting team-fight, in the heat of the moment, its just isn't that simple for lower level or inexperienced players (and I'm hardly excluding myself from them, I just recognize whats going on). It may be that the enemy ADC is in range, perhaps you could lock them down? Or, you're forced to use CC on a tank or other initiator to save one of your own carries. It could be that you started the fight without Kat around, and blew everything on the enemies who were there before her.

It could well be that these decisions are correct - if you can get the enemies other threats before Kat enters, you can easily focus her if she still does. If you peel effectively, she may not get a chance to enter untouched. If you can win a fight before she even gets there, she needs to be hella fed to go 1 v <however many you have left> and if she is, thats another story.

But if you are wrong, you lose hard. I'm not saying this is a bad thing, just that I see where the frustration comes from.

Low level players can't handle a lot of things, we shouldn't base information off of them.

Kats damage requires her to put herself in the middle of your team, squishy and vulnerable to do it. It doesn't take much thought process to save that extra ability for her, and if your team can't much up anything to interrupt her that is your fault and she simply came in at the right time.

Riven has a lot of weaknesses, some already well-detailed here.  She's pretty much a top-lane assassin, which means her all-in potential is spectacular and if she jumps you at mid to low health she will probably kill you.  But she has all the same weaknesses assassins do, and her being melee and not having great wave-clear accentuates this.  Here's another weakness of hers that wasn't mentioned.

She *has* to snowball.  A Riven that's not ahead is significantly behind.  Since she has minimal utility and only brings damage, she needs to be outscaling not only her lane opponent but also most of the enemy team in order to have any big impact outside of lane.  Tanky people who don't need a whole lot of farm (Maokai for instance) are her natural bane since they can pin her down in lane, not die to her combo, sustain through her burst, and keep her going even with them.  They will scale up mid to late game, she won't.  A Riven that isn't significantly fed is a Riven that's probably trying to jump into teamfights only to get killed by accident by the enemy mid-laner.

Another Riven op thread.
Learn to counter her people. She only wipes face when 2 conditions are met.

1: She knows she can all-in you. If she doesn't and does, it's entirely luck and they'll usually die. She bursts. She _has_ to be able to burst most toplane matchups. If she can't burst you down to a point where her passive AA kills you, you can and should be killing her.
2: Her shield is up for the all-in. Once a Riven has decided she's ready to wreck you, the shield has to be up against most toplane opponents as many champions actually outdamage her early on. It just doesn't seem that way because her shield takes away most of the damage you'd normally kill her with.

So... learning curve 101: If she can all-in you, play safe. Do **not** run out to grab that minion. Do **not** get in E+Q+W range. Staying in range of half her combo is usually fairly safe if you're a fighter or tank. If she's dumb enough to try and burst you using half her combo just to get to you, you should win if you actually know what you're doing. (Sidenote: Olaf massacres Riven because of this.)

Engage after she blows her E when you know _you_ can win. If you can tank _enough_ to kill her before she kills you, do it. She _will_ fall behind for little while. Then just ward so she doesn't pick up kills mid.

And this is a big one, I see this a lot. For the love of all things good, **do not chase her if she's _almost_ dead!** Getting that far probably did a number on you which means as soon her cooldowns reset while you're chasing her, she'll dash back to you and castrate you before you realize what happened. Let her back. More cs gold and xp for you. It's okay to get ahead that way. You'll kill her eventually.

Finally, pay attention to her items at all times. If she gets Tiamat or Brutalizer she gets a massive powerspike. Be aware of her damage output and how you'll hold up at all times. Going in to fight and "test it out" will just get you killed. Know ahead of time, don't engage, and laugh at the Riven prolly crying and raging over allchat cuz u won't engage. Farm up. It is OK not to get kills. Riven just baits noobs so hard. Learn people. She's not invincible. Kayle, Jax, and Yasuo last season, they were f%^ing GODS. I _know_ what op looks like now. Don't complain about a champ that can easily be outdone by just playing smart. She gets rolling when you guys don't understand her burst and she kills you for gold. _Learn, don't complain._ **That's** the mentality that will get you better at this game.

Now if your top laner feeds and she rolls into other lanes, that's a bit different. You'll mostly have to rely on vision control and grouping to catch her, but people should be warding anyway so that's not a special expectation for Riven. that fact that no one _does_ ward isn't something I can help you with. I usually just pester teammates to upgrade their trinkets and light up the map. Had a nice game last night where it worked. Map was lit up like Madison Square Garden. They couldn't take a dump without us knowing about it.

The same could be said of any champ though. Try killing a LeBlanc 3 levels ahead of all of you with 3 tanks covering her retreat from deletions. There's far worse than any Riven out there because Riven counterplay is easy to take advantage of, LeBlanc, Zed, Fizz, (insert assassin here) are usually much harder because of their escapes. meh. She snowballs extremely hard, and IMHO that's the only real "problem" with her. If she's behind, that shield won't make her tanky at all, and it really won't be hard to kill her before she kills anyone else.

It's not so much "she gets rewarded by going full damage with being tanky with the shield!!!1!", it's more of a she needs a way to not blow up instantly when trying to kill someone, since - bar the ranged EXECUTE, for which her target must be "low" to really hurt anyways - she's a squishy melee buying full damage. Zed has his shadows, Talon can try to disengage with mobility, Ahri has her Charm + being ranged, LeBlanc has her W return + being ranged (+ chains against melees..), xerath has range and a stun, fiora has temporary invulnerability (and a parry but eh, depending on who she's facing that can be useless).... riven has mobility to get to her target / try to get away (though have in mind that if she uses her mobility to get to you, she either loses part of her damage or she "wastes" her shield) and a shield to try and survive.

Problem arises when, IF she gets ahead, you CAN'T kill her, you CAN'T get near her or you die, you hardly can chase / escape from her, but eh, snowballing isn't unique to her. If you get snowballed on by an AD lane xin zhao, you'll get just as wrekt but with less counterplay since he just point-and-clicks you to death
